Articles.Content: This one just pop up on a contract, a kerbal stranded in low sun orbit about 2000Mm from kerbol need rescue. The pay is not that great too, just the same as any rescue mission in Kerbin system about 200k. But I never have the heart to turn down rescue mission... so here I go!

Ion Drives maybe your friend. Same with nukes with a roid attached. And Goodluck.

 o7

If you do manage to pull it off, my invisible tophat is coming off.

It'd be a whole lot more then I'd ever bother with.
On this episode of "World's Dumbest Space Programs"...

I got one too, I took it because I didn't have much money at the time (I got it very early, before first unmanned landing to mun/minmus...) but later cancelled it because the only way I could have recearched ion engines in time. would have been mun/minmust grinding or mobile lab abuse.

At that range, aren't they dead (or rather, cooked) already? And with the time it takes to get there and back, wouldn't they be dead already? So since they're dead already, why bother rescuing a corpse?
Low solar orbit? Easy; just go at night.
Sorry. Let him or her get a good tan, and decline the contract.

> 
> Low solar orbit? Easy; just go at night.

that is....totally kerbal....

leave no little kerb behind, must rescue, and then give that man a medal of kerbalness for getting stuck there in the first place. true hero amoung kerbals.
